name: html
blurb: The standard markup language used to create web pages and its elements form the building blocks of all websites.

name: css
blurb: A style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language.

name: javascript
blurb: An object-oriented computer programming language commonly used to create interactive effects within web browsers.

name: jquery
blurb: A JavaScript library that greatly simplifies JavaScript programming.

name: react
blurb: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

name: redux
blurb: A predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

name: node
blurb: An asynchronous event driven JavaScript runtime designed to build scalable network applications.

name: mongo
blurb: A NoSQL open-source cross-platform document-oriented database.

name: mongoose
blurb: A MongoDB object modeling tool designed to work in an asynchronous environment.

name: postresql
blurb: A powerful, open source object-relational database system.

name: express
blurb: A Node.js framework designed for building web applications and APIs.

name: mocha
blurb: A feature-rich JavaScript test framwork running on Node.js and in the browser.

name: chai
blurb: A BDD/TDD assertion library for Node.js and the browswer that can be paired with any JavaScript testing framework.
